column3: hi @laanwj and @promag \n\ncan u take a look again? let me know if there's any mistake, thx
Hi @laanwj \nthis PR has been open for a while,\ndoes it look good to you? :D
yes it looks ok to me, but someone who is closer with the wallet code should make sure it's correct

Concept meh.

I like having more documentation, but soon, the definition of some types is both going to change and have two meanings, depending on the ScriptPubKeyMan in use.

For example, ISMINE_SPENDABLE currently means that the wallet has enough private keys to produce a valid scriptSig/scriptWitness. But once we get descriptor wallets and other future ScriptPubKeyMan implementations, I
> meh\n\nI see. So should I wait for future implementations? Will adding "future ScriptPubKeyMans" doc be confusing ATM?

> Concept meh.
> 
> I like having more documentation, but soon, the definition of some types is both going to change and have two meanings, depending on the ScriptPubKeyMan in use.
> 
> For example, ISMINE_SPENDABLE currently means that the wallet has enough private keys to produce a valid scriptSig/scriptWitness. But once we get descriptor wallets and other future ScriptPubKeyMan implemen

> I like having more documentation, but soon, the definition of some types is both going to change and have two meanings, depending on the ScriptPubKeyMan in use.\n\nIf you disagree with the concept of documenting isminetype, please post in #17217. It's probably better to close that in that case so that people don't waste time trying to document it in a PR that gets stuck.

I'm concept ACK on this tbh, I see what Andrew means but the documentation is still useful, and I think we can keep the two alternative descriptions concise enough that it isn't bad to have it inline.
> Since descriptor wallets has been merged, I think we can update this to account for the semantic changes from there.\n\nNo problem!  I will read related PRs and work on that!
@HAOYUatHZ do you feel like updating this PR? Otherwise I'll pick it up
> @HAOYUatHZ do you feel like updating this PR? Otherwise I'll pick it up\n\n@S3RK sorry I forgot about it. I will update it this week
Maybe take a look again? @achow101  @S3RK

ACK 1bb2f52b7ece307fbf4c87c5da6633ca8574143a\n\nThe commit message should be cleaned up to not contain the entire history of changes. Also we don't @ mention people in commits as they will receive a notification every time someone pushes that particular commit to a repo.

> ACK [1bb2f52](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/1bb2f52b7ece307fbf4c87c5da6633ca8574143a)
> 
> The commit message should be cleaned up to not contain the entire history of changes. Also we don't @ mention people in commits as they will receive a notification every time someone pushes that particular commit to a repo.

I see. Thanks!
@HAOYUatHZ please fix the whitespace issue so this can be merged :)
> @HAOYUatHZ please fix the whitespace issue so this can be merged :)\n\nsorry for being late. fix!
Please use `//<! ` here so that doxygen picks up the descriptions
@laanwj    @fanquake \nfixed,  can u take a look again? thx~
nit, could keep comments aligned, like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/463eab5e1418a592036e7bf9bf46f66fe6462435/src/chain.h#L40-L51

> nit, could keep comments aligned, like
> 
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/463eab5e1418a592036e7bf9bf46f66fe6462435/src/chain.h#L40-L51

done.  thx for pointing it out
I don't think these two particular comments add anything to what is in the code. What about:\n"All ISMINE flags except for USED"\n"All ISMINE flags including USED"
used, not *re-*used, after all this is part of the avoid-reuse logic :smile:
also "(can spend with the private key)" doesn't belong here, `USED` doesn't imply anything about spendability in the future
Suggestion for lines 22 and 23: s/is corresponding/corresponds/
Suggestion: remove "contained"
s/an used/a used/\n\nReason: "used" is pronounced as if it began with the consonant "y"
(See discussion here https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16047#discussion_r285628201)
> Suggestion for lines 22 and 23: s/is corresponding/corresponds/\n\nfixed
> Suggestion: remove "contained"\n\nfixed

> s/an used/a used/
> 
> Reason: "used" is pronounced as if it began with the consonant "y"

fixed
This should note that this is only used for legacy wallets.

This should note that needing a private key is only for legacy wallets.\n\nIt would be good to mention somewhere that `DescriptorScriptPubKeyMan` (and future `ScriptPubKeyMan` implementations) will only use `ISMINE_NO` and `ISMINE_SPENDABLE`, essentially treating this as a boolean (except for ISMINE_USED which is kind of orthogonal to the other isminetypes).
`ISMINE_USED` is used by all `ScriptPubKeyMan` types, not just legacy.
Thx! Anything else I need to address?

In commit "doc: Add developer documentation to isminetype" (2400c3aadc2e3c87f5a1eda862bbb45213e9898f)\n\nNo need to change and this should all be [deduplicated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/fa8dd34e918cd80db215df8937aaf6bb1552fcd9/src/wallet/scriptpubkeyman.cpp#L56) later anyway, but from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17350#issuecomment-561388618 it sounded like maybe this s
